{"step_by_step_thinking": "The yellowing of the skin in this one-week-old infant is likely due to physiological jaundice, which is a common condition in newborns. In newborns, the liver is still immature and may not be able to process bilirubin efficiently, leading to its accumulation in the blood and subsequent yellowing of the skin. In this case, the infant is otherwise healthy, with no signs of distress or feeding difficulties. Therefore, the best treatment for physiological jaundice in this infant would be to continue normal breastfeeding.
